subject: Re: [junit] Servlet Testing - junit or httpunit
msgSnippet: Cactus or JUnitEE might be the tools you are looking for. HttpUnit is for black box testing only. The normal way to use it is with JUnit. You should find links
messageBody:
Cactus or JUnitEE might be the tools you are looking for. HttpUnit is for
black box testing only. The normal way to use it is with JUnit. You should
find links on the junit web pages.
Toyin
----- Original Message -----
From: <anand_73@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 08, 2001 7:53 AM
Subject: [junit] Servlet Testing - junit or httpunit


> Hi all
>
> I have started using junit and the documentation is pretty good to
> start writing testcases for generic java classes.
>
> Now to write testcases for Servlets,do I jump to httpunitest or stay
> with junit ?
>
> Kindly throw some light in this regard
> Anand
>
